IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: ADVANCE PUBLIC KNOWLEDGE AND APPRECIATION OF ARCHITECTURE. SEE SCHEDULE O.THE CHICAGO ARCHITECTURE FOUNDATION'S MISSION IS TO ADVANCE PUBLIC INTEREST AND EDUCATION IN ARCHITECTURE AND DESIGN, WHICH THE ORGANIZATION PURSUES THROUGH ARCHITECTURE TOURS, EXHIBITIONS, LECTURES, SPECIAL EVENTS, AS WELL AS ADULT, YOUTH AND FAMILY PROGRAMS. PROGRAMS ENHANCE APPRECIATION OF CHICAGO'S ARCHITECTURAL LEGACY, AND PROMOTE UNDERSTANDING AND ENCOURAGE DIALOGUE ABOUT HOW THE BUILT ENVIRONMENT SHAPES THE CITY'S FUTURE.
IRS990.MissionDescription: THE CHICAGO ARCHITECTURE FOUNDATION (CAF) IS DEDICATED TO ADVANCING PUBLIC INTEREST AND EDUCATION IN ARCHITECTURE AND RELATED DESIGN. THE ORGANIZATION PURSUES THIS MISSION THROUGH A COMPREHENSIVE PROGRAM OF ARCHITECTURE TOURS, EXHIBITIONS, LECTURES, SPECIAL EVENTS, AND YOUTH EDUCATION PROGRAMS, ALL DESIGNED TO ENHANCE PUBLIC AWARENESS AND APPRECIATION OF CHICAGO'S OUTSTANDING ARCHITECTURAL LEGACY.THE VISIONBECAUSE NO ART OTHER THAN ARCHITECTURE SO VIVIDLY EXPRESSES WHAT CHICAGO IS AND WHERE IT IS GOING, THE CHICAGO ARCHITECTURE FOUNDATION WILL CONTINUE TO EDUCATE THE PUBLIC TO EXPECT THE HIGHEST STANDARDS FROM CHICAGO'S BUILT ENVIRONMENT.
IRS990.Description: TOURS ARE THE HALLMARK OF THE CHICAGO ARCHITECTURE FOUNDATION, DRAWING 246,000 VISITORS FROM ALL OVER THE GLOBE BY OFFERING INSIGHTS INTO CHICAGO'S BUILDINGS, NEIGHBORHOODS, AND ENVIRONMENTS. CAF'S TOURS ARE KNOWN FOR THE HIGH QUALITY EXPERIENCE WITH 480 EXTENSIVELY TRAINED VOLUNTEER DOCENTS. ALL OF CAF'S TOURS ARE CONCEPTUALIZED, RESEARCHED, AND WRITTEN BY DOCENTS, WITH NEW OFFERINGS EACH YEAR. TOURS INCLUDE 85 DISTINCT WALKING, BOAT, BUS, AND BICYCLE TOURS AND ARE CONDUCTED 363 DAYS OF THE YEAR.

Activity2.Description: CAF OFFERS EXHIBITIONS AND PUBLIC PROGRAMS ON THE SUBJECT OF ARCHITECTURE AND THE BUILT ENVIRONMENT. IN 2010, APPROXIMATELY 153,000 PEOPLE SAW OUR EXHIBITIONS AND A TOTAL OF 7,786 PEOPLE ATTENDED PUBLIC PROGRAMS ON SUBJECTS SUCH AS SUSTAINABILITY, PRESERVATION, PLANNING AND DESIGN. THERE WERE 89 PROGRAMS OFFERED IN 2010 AND OF THE 89 PROGRAMS,43 WERE FREE (48%) AND 46 FEE-BASED (52%). CAF ALSO HOSTED THE SECOND ANNUAL AAO/A+DEN NATIONAL CONFERENCE,WHICH SERVED 157 DELEGATES.

Activity3.Description: THE YOUTH EDUCATION DEPARTMENT PROVIDES PROGRAMMING AND TOURS ON THE SUBJECT OF ARCHITECTURE AND THE BUILT ENVIRONMENT, COVERING CURRICULUM SUBJECTS OF SCIENCE, MATH AND ART, FOR K-12 STUDENTS AND TEACHERS. WE CONDUCTED 207 EVENTS DIRECTLY SERVING 11,062 STUDENTS AND TEACHERS, AND INDIRECTLY SERVING AN ADDITIONAL 14,835, FOR A TOTAL REACH OF 25,687 IN 2010. ATTENDANCE IS BROKEN DOWN AS FOLLOWS: 111 FIELD TRIPS FOR 4,038 K-8 STUDENTS FROM PUBLIC, PRIVATE, AND PAROCHIAL SCHOOLS FROM CHICAGO AND THE COLLAR COUNTIES; 171 TEACHERS ATTENDED SIX PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT WORKSHOPS, AND AN ADDITIONAL 77 TEACHERS ATTENDED PRE-SERVICE AND IN-SERVICE WORKSHOPS, FOR A TOTAL OF 248 TEACHERS PARTICIPATING IN HANDS-ON, BUILT ENVIRONMENT WORKSHOPS.

ActivityOther.Description: MUSEUM SHOP, MARKETING AND OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES

Form990PartVIISectionA.NamePerson: MICHAEL A TOOLIS AIA LEED AP
Form990PartVIISectionA.Title: TRUSTEE

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: CAF CREATED A LARGE SCALE DETAILED ACCURATE MODEL OF THE CITY OF CHICAGO IN ORDER TO EDUCATE THE PUBLIC ON CHICAGO ARCHITECTURE, PLANNING AND BUILT ENVIRONMENT.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: DESCRIPTION OF INTENDED USE OF ENDOWMENT FUNDS:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE FOUNDATION'S ENDOWMENT CONSISTS OF TWO INDIVIDUAL FUNDS THAT ENSURE THE CONTINUING VIABILITY OF THE FOUNDATION SO THAT FUTURE GENERATIONS OF VISITORS AND RESIDENTS MAY EXPERIENCE, UNDERSTAND, AND APPRECIATE THE BUILT ENVIRONMENT, BOTH IN CHICAGO AND BEYOND.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: DESCRIPTION OF UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS UNDER FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE FOUNDATION'S APPLICATION OF GAAPUSA REGARDING UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS HAD NO EFFECT ON ITS FINANCIAL POSITION AS MANAGEMENT BELIEVES THE FOUNDATION HAS NO MATERIAL UNRECOGNIZED INCOME TAX BENEFITS, INCLUDING ANY POTENTIAL RISK OF LOSS OF ITS NOT-FOR-PROFIT TAX STATUS. THE FOUNDATION WOULD ACCOUNT FOR ANY POTENTIAL INTEREST OR PENALTIES RELATED TO POSSIBLE FUTURE LIABILITIES FOR UNRECOGNIZED INCOME TAX BENEFITS AS INCOME TAX EXPENSE. THE FOUNDATION IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY FEDERAL, STATE OR LOCAL TAX AUTHORITIES FOR PERIODS BEFORE 2007.

FundraiserActivityInformation.Activity: CONSULTING ON CHICAGO ARCHITECTURE CENTER CAMPAIGN

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: THE CHICAGO ARCHITECTURE FOUNDATION PAYS FOR THE CEO'S MONTHLY DUES TO THE UNIVERSITY CLUB, WHICH IS A MEMBERSHIP ORGANIZATION THAT IS USED FOR BUSINESS MEETINGS, LUNCHES FOR PROSPECTIVE DONORS, AND EVENTS ON THE BEHALF OF CAF. THE CEO REIMBURSES THE ORGANIZATION FOR ANY PERSONAL EXPENSES.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE DOCENT COUNCIL, A LARGE VOLUNTEER BODY OF THE ORGANIZATION, ELECTS TWO DOCENTS TO BE VOTING TRUSTEES EX-OFFICIO. THE AUXILIARY BOARD ELECTS THEIR PRESIDENT WHO ALSO SERVES AS A VOTING TRUSTEE EX-OFFICIO.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE BOARD RETAINS THE SERVICES OF AN INDEPENDENT CPA FIRM TO PREPARE THE ORGANIZATION'S FORM 990. MANAGEMENT REVIEWS THE COMPLETED FORM 990 AND PROVIDES A FULL COPY TO ALL VOTING MEMBERS OF THE GOVERNING BODY PRIOR TO FILING. THE GOVERNING BODY IS PROVIDED A REASONABLE AMOUNT OF TIME TO REVIEW THE RETURN AND ASK ANY QUESTIONS DIRECTLY TO ORGANIZATION MANAGEMENT OR THE CONTACT AT THE INDEPENDENT CPA FIRM PRIOR TO FILING. A MEETING IS SCHEDULED FOR THE CPA FIRM AND ORGANIZATIONS MANAGEMENT TO DISCUSS THE FORM 990 WITH THE FINANCE COMMITTEE.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: OFFICERS, TRUSTEES AND KEY EMPLOYEES ARE ANNUALLY REQUIRED TO COMPLETE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST DISCLOSURE STATEMENT AS A PRECURSOR TO THEIR SERVICE TO THE ORGANIZATION. POTENTIAL CONFLICTS ARE LOGGED AND MONITORED BY THE FINANCE COMMITTEE.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES REVIEWS ON AN ANNUAL BASIS THE COMPENSATION OF THE CEO AND CFO. PERIODICALLY, AN INDEPENDENT COMPENSATION CONSULTANT IS HIRED TO EVALUATE THE COMPENSATION OF TOP MANAGEMENT. THE CEO HAS AN EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT WHICH IS APPROVED BY THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES IN WHICH COMPENSATION IS EVALUATED ANNUALLY BASED ON PERFORMANCE AND SPECIFIC GOALS OUTLINED IN THE PRIOR FISCAL YEAR.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE THROUGH APPLICABLE GOVERNMENT AGENCIES AND UPON REQUEST; THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS AVAILABLE UPON WRITTEN REQUEST TO THE ORGANIZATION.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: CHANGES IN NET ASSETS OR FUND BALANCES:
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: NET UNREALIZED LOSSES ON INVESTMENTS: -2,485. DONATED SERVICES AND USE OF FACILITIES: 2,500. TOTAL TO FORM 990, PART XI, LINE 5: 15.
